message:
Domain of technology is expanding day by day. Every day we come across various new inventions and thoughts that have the mettle to shake the world. Ideas, records and documents can be hacked by anyone, anywhere, anytime in the world, thus, the need of the time is that one should know about protection of his/her idea.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with IBM presents its sixth workshop ‘Patenting & Enterprise Applications - Security and Analytics of System of Records’.
Register at www.ktj.in/workshop

Here's your chance to be a part of Asia's Largest Techno-Management Fest.So, make sure of your presence on 5th January at Technology Students' Gymkhana for Volunteer and Deco Team Selections for Kshitij 2018.

SN,MT - 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM

NEHRU,AZAD,PATEL - 8:30 PM to 9:00 PM
PG - 9:30 PM to 10:30 PM
Register at tinyurl.com/voluktj2018

story: Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.

message:
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Technology Robotix Society presents you 'Fortress'. A nuclear war just affected our planet. And the robots are now trying to save the remaining humans in a habitable environment by building an impenetrable fortress. In order to do this, they have to collect all the suitable blocks in the proper order in a given time before they lose any more lives.

Prizes Worth INR 45,000
For more information go to : https://www.robotix.in/event/fortress/
Register at www.ktj.in/event
#KTJ2k18

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Technology Robotix Society presents you 'Poles Apart'. The engineers are trying to design a vehicle that is capable of adapting itself to the rough terrain it is sent into. You are asked to design the prototype of such a bot that is capable of changing the distance between its wheels so as to cover a ground that cannot be done otherwise. There are multiple valleys that converge, diverge or are in an arc form and are to be crossed. 
Your challenge is to design a bot robust enough to adapt itself according to the valleys it faces. There are also certain parts of the path that you need to complete before you can cover the further ground. Use a mechanical gripper to complete this problem statement.

Prizes Worth INR 45,000
For more information go to: www.robotix.in/event/poles-apart/
Register at www.ktj.in/event
#KTJ2k18

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Technology Robotix Society presents you 'STAX'. 
Consider the situation of a factory where heavy machine parts are kept in a random manner and need to be kept correctly for assembling. An autonomous robot will not only make the job easy but also optimize the number of movements.

Prizes Worth INR 45,000
For more information go to : www.robotix.in/event/stax/
Register at www.ktj.in/event
#KTJ2k18

In the hustle of life, one more year has passed, stuffed with sweet recollections and cheerful times, only to make way for what promises to be a memorable voyage. May this year bring unconditional happiness, new goals, miraculous achievements and a lot of inspirations in your life. 
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a very Happy New Year.
#KTJ2k18

While the LED revolution may be over, the story of intelligent lighting is just beginning. Secure connected lighting systems and Internet of Things are powering smarter cities, more efficient buildings and innovative retail experiences by providing real-time data analytics. 
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Philips India presents its fifth workshop 'Internet of Things and Lighting'.

Register at www.ktj.in/workshop

"Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—
I took the one less traveled by" - Robert Frost

When everybody is running behind their fantasies of learning programming, here is the chance for you to move a step ahead and stand out in the crowd. Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Google Developers present its fourth workshop 'Getting Started with Reactive Programming in Java, Kotlin, and Android'. 

Register at www.ktj.in/workshop

All the coding enthusiasts out there, get prepared to test your knowledge and concepts of UNIX and challenge the best coders around you by hacking into Ubuntu operating system and debbuging the error for the smooth running of the code.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur presents Unix Hackpro to extract the best out of a coding aficionado.

Prizes worth INR 30,000
Register at www.ktj.in/event

With rapidly increasing population and demand for energy, sustainable development is vital for a better future. Researchers all across the world are deploying new energy and resource-optimizing solutions which are sustainable and cost-effective. 
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur presents the 3rd tech giant in its workshop series. Design of Sustainable Innovations by Mahindra Rise.

Register at www.ktj.in/workshop

Robotic Soccer is an example of complex tasks in which multiple agents need to collaborate in an adversarial environment to achieve specific objectives. It offers a challenging research domain to investigate a large spectrum of issues relevant to the development of complete autonomous agents.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Kharagpur RoboSoccer Students' Group (KRSSG) presents Code-O-Soccer, a simulation-based strategy coding competition, where soccer strategies brewing within one's mind are implemented on a robot.

Prizes worth INR 50,000
Register at www.ktj.in/event
For more details visit http://event.krssg.in/
Facebook forum to get the insight on the event:- http://tinyurl.com/code-o-soccer
Submit your codes before 5th January 2018
#KTJ2k18

With the invention of Sophia, the first social humanoid robot to receive citizenship of any country, it has been proved that we are going to begin a new era in the field of AI. 
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Microsoft presents its second workshop, 'Human like-AI' which is intended for all those computer enthusiasts having interest in gaming, computing, and AI. 

Note: It is mandatory to bring your own laptops for this workshop.

Register at www.ktj.in/workshop
#KTJ2k18
#Workshop2

AI and HPC are changing the way every industry thinks. These large computations are changing product design and leading to discoveries and innovations not previously possible. It is really an exciting time to be working in the cloud!
Graphics Processing Units (GPUs) provide much more computing power and data processing capability than conventional computing architectures.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with NVIDIA India presents its first workshop GPU computing fuels AI & HPC which is intended for all those computer enthusiasts having interest in gaming, computing, and AI.

Register at www.ktj.in/workshop
#KTJ2k18
